title.title: Travel Advice: Baker Street station closed this evening

texts: London Underground (LU) advised passengers that Baker Street station will be closed for the rest of the afternoon and into the evening due to a major gas leak outside the station.
Trains are running through, but not stopping at the station.
National Grid has dug up the road and is repairing the gas leak and hope to have it fixed so that the station can re-open this evening.
Passengers who normally enter, exit or interchange at Baker Street station are advised to find an alternative station, but to check before they travel via the following options:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The TfL website: \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/tubeworks\"\u003ewww.tfl.gov.uk/tubeworks\u003c/a\u003e ","The London travel information 24-hour telephone helpline: 020 7222 1234","BBC Ceefax, page 436, or ITV's Teletext, page 164","Information on posters, leaflets and \"Good Service\" boards at Tube stations\u003cbr /\u003e"]}

For 24-hour information on public transport in London, please call: 020 7222 1234.

TfL's Realtime pages display live travel information on London's public transport network: www.tfl.gov.uk/realtime
Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route is shown automatically: www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at: www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts
